REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout            Goto page 1, 2, 3, 4  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:50 pm            A gender-flipped Isekai (totally not BL) romcom!    This is turning out to be a surprisingly fun and cute show. MAO and Satoshi Hino are really delivering as their respective characters, and the comedy writing is on-point.      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1148       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:17 pm              Quote:    While the characters (and possibly the show itself) might insist that's the work of the mysterious curse placed on them by the Goddess, it's equally possible this genderbending chicanery has just opened the door for both parties to consider possibilities they never dared to consider while both had male bodies.           Maybe it's just me but I thought that this was made amply clear in episode two the latest... but even in episode one Jinguuji calls Tachibana his "paradise", the only one at whose side he feels comfortable, etc., is aghast at the idea of his "best friend" being taken away from him by some wench, and generally behaves like any "super darling" type romantic male lead. And then in episode two his "I love this about you" moment prompts a long flashback about male!Tachibana...    The premise may be problematic (I don't necessarily see it as such though) but I don't think the show has ever tried to insist that their feelings are actually the work of the curse. If anything I think it's going in a "you were always in love you just didn't realize it because both of you were guys" direction.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:58 pm            I was surprised by how enjoyable this little show is.  Brings a smile.      Back to top                    trilaan    Joined: 17 Jan 2009 		    Posts: 965 		    Location: Texas 		        Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 6:44 am            I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 9:46 am              trilaan wrote:    I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.            I have read quite a bit of the light novel of that one, and the anime does the same thing to me.  If I had not read it, I would have no clue what is going on, but even then it changed a lot, skips so much.. I have no idea what they are trying to accomplish but I am not happy.      Back to top                    maximilianjenus    Joined: 29 Apr 2013 		    Posts: 2571       Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 9:44 am              trilaan wrote:    I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.            yeah gender bent Isekai has to focus on that fact or give a good reason why the fact is plot irrelevant. the pupil one does neither, one unnamed game Isekai does something pretty clever the male mc does not seem to be affected by the gender change but as the plot progresses he realizes he is acting more and more like the game character, so there is something fishy going on, as in , his personality is meeting with the original body owner and that is why he never felt the gender change.   I love what the reviewer painted out for telulilo , it confirms the theory that source readers felt similar and spoiler[telulilo is gone asap and the author later tries with other characters]      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 11:03 am            I feel both amused and kind of bad for the elf Premier for how badly this episode went for her.      Back to top                  Leviathonlx1    Joined: 10 Dec 2018 		    Posts: 74       Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 1:35 pm              Moonsaber wrote:       trilaan wrote:    I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.            I have read quite a bit of the light novel of that one, and the anime does the same thing to me.  If I had not read it, I would have no clue what is going on, but even then it changed a lot, skips so much.. I have no idea what they are trying to accomplish but I am not happy.            She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man came off as the author just adding the gender bender tag to make their WN stick out amongst all the other 'cute girl doing cute things' stories on the WN website since the gender bending aspect basically is irrelevant as the MC acts fully like a girl from the very start.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 2:05 pm              Leviathonlx1 wrote:      She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man came off as the author just adding the gender bender tag to make their WN stick out amongst all the other 'cute girl doing cute things' stories on the WN website since the gender bending aspect basically is irrelevant as the MC acts fully like a girl from the very start.            I have read through the first few arcs and I (Mildly) disagree with that.  The MC expresses a lot of dismay and embarrassment over it, though I think that secretly the form pleases them.   In the Anime.. yeah, she doesn't miss a beat.   In the WN, she spends a lot of time mourning the loss of the "Wizened Wizard" persona, off and on, but at a certain point seems to give up and embrace the new form.  Not a lot of time is spent on it, and.. it is not exactly a very deep WN.      Back to top                    Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Feb 02, 2022 10:55 am            Ep 4   "Who's Audrey?"  Lol, for some reason "Audrey-san" cracks me up more than Schwartz Lichtenstein Lohengramm does.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 12:32 pm            Schwa-kun and Lucius really have livened up an already lively cast, and we're also starting to get into the Demon Lord and their forces.   Boyfriend Shirt Tachibana, Bunny Girl Tachibana, Maid Tachibana...Jinguuji unlocking a lot of fetishes.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 1:45 pm            They had me going for a second with how they handled Lucius' losing her clothes, because I'd assumed she was a woman from the start, and they made it look at first like she had no breasts, so I was surprised she was a guy.  Then Tachibana flipped that back.  So I guess we had similar reactions, but in opposite directions, which, if that was their intention, was pretty clever.   Boyfriend shirt was pure gold.  Not too crazy about the demon lord's hyper gremlin though.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 7:26 am            I was considering dropping this (I've already dropped Wise man's loli and Leadale) but the last two episodes have been solid.   Once they introduced "Charmed" Jinguuji  didn't stand a chance, now all the Otome cliché's are truly out to get him....    "Boyfriend shirt" - top anime couple trigger...   Having re-watched the first episode the goddess didn't specifically mention what the curse was apart from the desire to "defeat the demon king". So they're probably suffering from their bromance being magnified now the potential homosexual hang-up has been removed.   Schwa-kun makes a good Kirito parody and if his real name is reveled and it is an SAO reference it'll be all the better.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 3:10 pm            Taking Jinguuji as his desert island item was great, but I can't get over "cellophane tape."        Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 6:47 pm            Schwa's Goddess was not what I was expecting. She seems pretty chill and cool, and gets along well with Schwa.   Ah, Tachibana thinks Jinguuji is as powerful as a sacred weapon! Which did pay off in their new fantasy life.   I guess this is the last we'll see of Schwa and co. since he's sticking around in the village. Well, at least they respect him now. His Goddess has no idea he lost his sword though.    Poor Elf Premier. Gets kidnapped and the pair don't lift a finger to save her, then she thinks she's going to be ravished...then sacrificed...all because she's so beautiful...and then Tachibana steals her thunder. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout            Goto page 1, 2, 3, 4  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:50 pm            A gender-flipped Isekai (totally not BL) romcom!    This is turning out to be a surprisingly fun and cute show. MAO and Satoshi Hino are really delivering as their respective characters, and the comedy writing is on-point.      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1148       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:17 pm              Quote:    While the characters (and possibly the show itself) might insist that's the work of the mysterious curse placed on them by the Goddess, it's equally possible this genderbending chicanery has just opened the door for both parties to consider possibilities they never dared to consider while both had male bodies.           Maybe it's just me but I thought that this was made amply clear in episode two the latest... but even in episode one Jinguuji calls Tachibana his "paradise", the only one at whose side he feels comfortable, etc., is aghast at the idea of his "best friend" being taken away from him by some wench, and generally behaves like any "super darling" type romantic male lead. And then in episode two his "I love this about you" moment prompts a long flashback about male!Tachibana...    The premise may be problematic (I don't necessarily see it as such though) but I don't think the show has ever tried to insist that their feelings are actually the work of the curse. If anything I think it's going in a "you were always in love you just didn't realize it because both of you were guys" direction.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:58 pm            I was surprised by how enjoyable this little show is.  Brings a smile.      Back to top                    trilaan    Joined: 17 Jan 2009 		    Posts: 965 		    Location: Texas 		        Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 6:44 am            I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Fri Jan 21, 2022 9:46 am              trilaan wrote:    I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.            I have read quite a bit of the light novel of that one, and the anime does the same thing to me.  If I had not read it, I would have no clue what is going on, but even then it changed a lot, skips so much.. I have no idea what they are trying to accomplish but I am not happy.      Back to top                    maximilianjenus    Joined: 29 Apr 2013 		    Posts: 2571       Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 9:44 am              trilaan wrote:    I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.            yeah gender bent Isekai has to focus on that fact or give a good reason why the fact is plot irrelevant. the pupil one does neither, one unnamed game Isekai does something pretty clever the male mc does not seem to be affected by the gender change but as the plot progresses he realizes he is acting more and more like the game character, so there is something fishy going on, as in , his personality is meeting with the original body owner and that is why he never felt the gender change.   I love what the reviewer painted out for telulilo , it confirms the theory that source readers felt similar and spoiler[telulilo is gone asap and the author later tries with other characters]      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 11:03 am            I feel both amused and kind of bad for the elf Premier for how badly this episode went for her.      Back to top                  Leviathonlx1    Joined: 10 Dec 2018 		    Posts: 74       Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 1:35 pm              Moonsaber wrote:       trilaan wrote:    I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.            I have read quite a bit of the light novel of that one, and the anime does the same thing to me.  If I had not read it, I would have no clue what is going on, but even then it changed a lot, skips so much.. I have no idea what they are trying to accomplish but I am not happy.            She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man came off as the author just adding the gender bender tag to make their WN stick out amongst all the other 'cute girl doing cute things' stories on the WN website since the gender bending aspect basically is irrelevant as the MC acts fully like a girl from the very start.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 2:05 pm              Leviathonlx1 wrote:      She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man came off as the author just adding the gender bender tag to make their WN stick out amongst all the other 'cute girl doing cute things' stories on the WN website since the gender bending aspect basically is irrelevant as the MC acts fully like a girl from the very start.            I have read through the first few arcs and I (Mildly) disagree with that.  The MC expresses a lot of dismay and embarrassment over it, though I think that secretly the form pleases them.   In the Anime.. yeah, she doesn't miss a beat.   In the WN, she spends a lot of time mourning the loss of the "Wizened Wizard" persona, off and on, but at a certain point seems to give up and embrace the new form.  Not a lot of time is spent on it, and.. it is not exactly a very deep WN.      Back to top                    Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Feb 02, 2022 10:55 am            Ep 4   "Who's Audrey?"  Lol, for some reason "Audrey-san" cracks me up more than Schwartz Lichtenstein Lohengramm does.      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 12:32 pm            Schwa-kun and Lucius really have livened up an already lively cast, and we're also starting to get into the Demon Lord and their forces.   Boyfriend Shirt Tachibana, Bunny Girl Tachibana, Maid Tachibana...Jinguuji unlocking a lot of fetishes.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 1:45 pm            They had me going for a second with how they handled Lucius' losing her clothes, because I'd assumed she was a woman from the start, and they made it look at first like she had no breasts, so I was surprised she was a guy.  Then Tachibana flipped that back.  So I guess we had similar reactions, but in opposite directions, which, if that was their intention, was pretty clever.   Boyfriend shirt was pure gold.  Not too crazy about the demon lord's hyper gremlin though.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 7:26 am            I was considering dropping this (I've already dropped Wise man's loli and Leadale) but the last two episodes have been solid.   Once they introduced "Charmed" Jinguuji  didn't stand a chance, now all the Otome cliché's are truly out to get him....    "Boyfriend shirt" - top anime couple trigger...   Having re-watched the first episode the goddess didn't specifically mention what the curse was apart from the desire to "defeat the demon king". So they're probably suffering from their bromance being magnified now the potential homosexual hang-up has been removed.   Schwa-kun makes a good Kirito parody and if his real name is reveled and it is an SAO reference it'll be all the better.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 3:10 pm            Taking Jinguuji as his desert island item was great, but I can't get over "cellophane tape."        Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 6:47 pm            Schwa's Goddess was not what I was expecting. She seems pretty chill and cool, and gets along well with Schwa.   Ah, Tachibana thinks Jinguuji is as powerful as a sacred weapon! Which did pay off in their new fantasy life.   I guess this is the last we'll see of Schwa and co. since he's sticking around in the village. Well, at least they respect him now. His Goddess has no idea he lost his sword though.    Poor Elf Premier. Gets kidnapped and the pair don't lift a finger to save her, then she thinks she's going to be ravished...then sacrificed...all because she's so beautiful...and then Tachibana steals her thunder. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout            Goto page 1, 2, 3, 4  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:50 pm            A gender-flipped Isekai (totally not BL) romcom!    This is turning out to be a surprisingly fun and cute show. MAO and Satoshi Hino are really delivering as their respective characters, and the comedy writing is on-point.      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1148       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:17 pm              Quote:    While the characters (and possibly the show itself) might insist that's the work of the mysterious curse placed on them by the Goddess, it's equally possible this genderbending chicanery has just opened the door for both parties to consider possibilities they never dared to consider while both had male bodies.           Maybe it's just me but I thought that this was made amply clear in episode two the latest... but even in episode one Jinguuji calls Tachibana his "paradise", the only one at whose side he feels comfortable, etc., is aghast at the idea of his "best friend" being taken away from him by some wench, and generally behaves like any "super darling" type romantic male lead. And then in episode two his "I love this about you" moment prompts a long flashback about male!Tachibana...    The premise may be problematic (I don't necessarily see it as such though) but I don't think the show has ever tried to insist that their feelings are actually the work of the curse. If anything I think it's going in a "you were always in love you just didn't realize it because both of you were guys" direction.      Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:58 pm            I was surprised by how enjoyable this little show is.  Brings a smile. I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season. I love what the reviewer painted out for telulilo , it confirms the theory that source readers felt similar and spoiler[telulilo is gone asap and the author later tries with other characters]      Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 11:03 am            I feel both amused and kind of bad for the elf Premier for how badly this episode went for her. Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 2:05 pm              Leviathonlx1 wrote:      She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man came off as the author just adding the gender bender tag to make their WN stick out amongst all the other 'cute girl doing cute things' stories on the WN website since the gender bending aspect basically is irrelevant as the MC acts fully like a girl from the very start.            I have read through the first few arcs and I (Mildly) disagree with that.  The MC expresses a lot of dismay and embarrassment over it, though I think that secretly the form pleases them.   In the Anime.. yeah, she doesn't miss a beat.   In the WN, she spends a lot of time mourning the loss of the "Wizened Wizard" persona, off and on, but at a certain point seems to give up and embrace the new form.  Not a lot of time is spent on it, and.. it is not exactly a very deep WN. Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 12:32 pm            Schwa-kun and Lucius really have livened up an already lively cast, and we're also starting to get into the Demon Lord and their forces.   Boyfriend Shirt Tachibana, Bunny Girl Tachibana, Maid Tachibana...Jinguuji unlocking a lot of fetishes.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 1:45 pm            They had me going for a second with how they handled Lucius' losing her clothes, because I'd assumed she was a woman from the start, and they made it look at first like she had no breasts, so I was surprised she was a guy.  Then Tachibana flipped that back.  So I guess we had similar reactions, but in opposite directions, which, if that was their intention, was pretty clever.   Boyfriend shirt was pure gold.  Not too crazy about the demon lord's hyper gremlin though.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 7:26 am            I was considering dropping this (I've already dropped Wise man's loli and Leadale) but the last two episodes have been solid.   Once they introduced "Charmed" Jinguuji  didn't stand a chance, now all the Otome cliché's are truly out to get him....    "Boyfriend shirt" - top anime couple trigger...   Having re-watched the first episode the goddess didn't specifically mention what the curse was apart from the desire to "defeat the demon king". So they're probably suffering from their bromance being magnified now the potential homosexual hang-up has been removed.   Schwa-kun makes a good Kirito parody and if his real name is reveled and it is an SAO reference it'll be all the better. Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 6:47 pm            Schwa's Goddess was not what I was expecting. I guess this is the last we'll see of Schwa and co. since he's sticking around in the village. Well, at least they respect him now. His Goddess has no idea he lost his sword though.    Poor Elf Premier. Gets kidnapped and the pair don't lift a finger to save her, then she thinks she's going to be ravished...then sacrificed...all because she's so beautiful...and then Tachibana steals her thunder. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout            Goto page 1, 2, 3, 4  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:50 pm            A gender-flipped Isekai (totally not BL) romcom!    This is turning out to be a surprisingly fun and cute show. MAO and Satoshi Hino are really delivering as their respective characters, and the comedy writing is on-point.      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1148       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:17 pm              Quote:    While the characters (and possibly the show itself) might insist that's the work of the mysterious curse placed on them by the Goddess, it's equally possible this genderbending chicanery has just opened the door for both parties to consider possibilities they never dared to consider while both had male bodies.           Maybe it's just me but I thought that this was made amply clear in episode two the latest... but even in episode one Jinguuji calls Tachibana his "paradise", the only one at whose side he feels comfortable, etc., is aghast at the idea of his "best friend" being taken away from him by some wench, and generally behaves like any "super darling" type romantic male lead. And then in episode two his "I love this about you" moment prompts a long flashback about male!Tachibana...    The premise may be problematic (I don't necessarily see it as such though) but I don't think the show has ever tried to insist that their feelings are actually the work of the curse. If anything I think it's going in a "you were always in love you just didn't realize it because both of you were guys" direction. Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 2:05 pm              Leviathonlx1 wrote:      She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man came off as the author just adding the gender bender tag to make their WN stick out amongst all the other 'cute girl doing cute things' stories on the WN website since the gender bending aspect basically is irrelevant as the MC acts fully like a girl from the very start. In the Anime.. yeah, she doesn't miss a beat.   In the WN, she spends a lot of time mourning the loss of the "Wizened Wizard" persona, off and on, but at a certain point seems to give up and embrace the new form. Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 12:32 pm            Schwa-kun and Lucius really have livened up an already lively cast, and we're also starting to get into the Demon Lord and their forces.   Boyfriend Shirt Tachibana, Bunny Girl Tachibana, Maid Tachibana...Jinguuji unlocking a lot of fetishes.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 1:45 pm            They had me going for a second with how they handled Lucius' losing her clothes, because I'd assumed she was a woman from the start, and they made it look at first like she had no breasts, so I was surprised she was a guy.  Then Tachibana flipped that back.  So I guess we had similar reactions, but in opposite directions, which, if that was their intention, was pretty clever.   Boyfriend shirt was pure gold.  Not too crazy about the demon lord's hyper gremlin though.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 7:26 am            I was considering dropping this (I've already dropped Wise man's loli and Leadale) but the last two episodes have been solid.   Once they introduced "Charmed" Jinguuji  didn't stand a chance, now all the Otome cliché's are truly out to get him....    "Boyfriend shirt" - top anime couple trigger...   Having re-watched the first episode the goddess didn't specifically mention what the curse was apart from the desire to "defeat the demon king". So they're probably suffering from their bromance being magnified now the potential homosexual hang-up has been removed.   Schwa-kun makes a good Kirito parody and if his real name is reveled and it is an SAO reference it'll be all the better.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 3:10 pm            Taking Jinguuji as his desert island item was great, but I can't get over "cellophane tape."        Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 6:47 pm            Schwa's Goddess was not what I was expecting. She seems pretty chill and cool, and gets along well with Schwa.   Ah, Tachibana thinks Jinguuji is as powerful as a sacred weapon! Which did pay off in their new fantasy life.   I guess this is the last we'll see of Schwa and co. since he's sticking around in the village. Well, at least they respect him now. His Goddess has no idea he lost his sword though.    Poor Elf Premier. Gets kidnapped and the pair don't lift a finger to save her, then she thinks she's going to be ravished...then sacrificed...all because she's so beautiful...and then Tachibana steals her thunder. Title: EP. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Forum - View topicEP. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout            Goto page 1, 2, 3, 4  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:50 pm            A gender-flipped Isekai (totally not BL) romcom!    This is turning out to be a surprisingly fun and cute show. MAO and Satoshi Hino are really delivering as their respective characters, and the comedy writing is on-point.      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1148       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:17 pm              Quote:    While the characters (and possibly the show itself) might insist that's the work of the mysterious curse placed on them by the Goddess, it's equally possible this genderbending chicanery has just opened the door for both parties to consider possibilities they never dared to consider while both had male bodies.           Maybe it's just me but I thought that this was made amply clear in episode two the latest... but even in episode one Jinguuji calls Tachibana his "paradise", the only one at whose side he feels comfortable, etc., is aghast at the idea of his "best friend" being taken away from him by some wench, and generally behaves like any "super darling" type romantic male lead. And then in episode two his "I love this about you" moment prompts a long flashback about male!Tachibana...    The premise may be problematic (I don't necessarily see it as such though) but I don't think the show has ever tried to insist that their feelings are actually the work of the curse. If anything I think it's going in a "you were always in love you just didn't realize it because both of you were guys" direction. Back to top                  Moonsaber    Joined: 16 Jan 2007 		    Posts: 316 		    Location: USA 		        Posted: Fri Jan 28, 2022 2:05 pm              Leviathonlx1 wrote:      She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man came off as the author just adding the gender bender tag to make their WN stick out amongst all the other 'cute girl doing cute things' stories on the WN website since the gender bending aspect basically is irrelevant as the MC acts fully like a girl from the very start.            I have read through the first few arcs and I (Mildly) disagree with that.  The MC expresses a lot of dismay and embarrassment over it, though I think that secretly the form pleases them.   In the Anime.. yeah, she doesn't miss a beat.   In the WN, she spends a lot of time mourning the loss of the "Wizened Wizard" persona, off and on, but at a certain point seems to give up and embrace the new form.  Not a lot of time is spent on it, and.. it is not exactly a very deep WN. Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 12:32 pm            Schwa-kun and Lucius really have livened up an already lively cast, and we're also starting to get into the Demon Lord and their forces.   Boyfriend Shirt Tachibana, Bunny Girl Tachibana, Maid Tachibana...Jinguuji unlocking a lot of fetishes.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Thu Feb 10, 2022 1:45 pm            They had me going for a second with how they handled Lucius' losing her clothes, because I'd assumed she was a woman from the start, and they made it look at first like she had no breasts, so I was surprised she was a guy.  Then Tachibana flipped that back.  So I guess we had similar reactions, but in opposite directions, which, if that was their intention, was pretty clever.   Boyfriend shirt was pure gold.  Not too crazy about the demon lord's hyper gremlin though.      Back to top                  Penrhos    Joined: 09 Jun 2021 		    Posts: 86       Posted: Fri Feb 11, 2022 7:26 am            I was considering dropping this (I've already dropped Wise man's loli and Leadale) but the last two episodes have been solid.   Once they introduced "Charmed" Jinguuji  didn't stand a chance, now all the Otome cliché's are truly out to get him....    "Boyfriend shirt" - top anime couple trigger...   Having re-watched the first episode the goddess didn't specifically mention what the curse was apart from the desire to "defeat the demon king". So they're probably suffering from their bromance being magnified now the potential homosexual hang-up has been removed.   Schwa-kun makes a good Kirito parody and if his real name is reveled and it is an SAO reference it'll be all the better.      Back to top                  Gina Szanboti    Joined: 03 Aug 2008 		    Posts: 10216       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 3:10 pm            Taking Jinguuji as his desert island item was great, but I can't get over "cellophane tape."        Back to top                  MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Feb 16, 2022 6:47 pm            Schwa's Goddess was not what I was expecting. She seems pretty chill and cool, and gets along well with Schwa.   Ah, Tachibana thinks Jinguuji is as powerful as a sacred weapon! Which did pay off in their new fantasy life.   I guess this is the last we'll see of Schwa and co. since he's sticking around in the village. Well, at least they respect him now. His Goddess has no idea he lost his sword though.    Poor Elf Premier. Gets kidnapped and the pair don't lift a finger to save her, then she thinks she's going to be ravished...then sacrificed...all because she's so beautiful...and then Tachibana steals her thunder. Title: EP. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: Goto page 1, 2, 3, 4  Next Note: this is the discussion thread for this article     Anime News Network Forum Index -> Site-related -> Talkback    View previous topic :: View next topic     Author Message        MFrontier    Joined: 13 Apr 2014 		    Posts: 3764       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 3:50 pm            A gender-flipped Isekai (totally not BL) romcom!    This is turning out to be a surprisingly fun and cute show. MAO and Satoshi Hino are really delivering as their respective characters, and the comedy writing is on-point.      Back to top                  SHD    Joined: 05 Apr 2015 		    Posts: 1148       Posted: Wed Jan 19, 2022 4:17 pm              Quote:    While the characters (and possibly the show itself) might insist that's the work of the mysterious curse placed on them by the Goddess, it's equally possible this genderbending chicanery has just opened the door for both parties to consider possibilities they never dared to consider while both had male bodies.           Maybe it's just me but I thought that this was made amply clear in episode two the latest... but even in episode one Jinguuji calls Tachibana his "paradise", the only one at whose side he feels comfortable, etc., is aghast at the idea of his "best friend" being taken away from him by some wench, and generally behaves like any "super darling" type romantic male lead. And then in episode two his "I love this about you" moment prompts a long flashback about male!Tachibana...    The premise may be problematic (I don't necessarily see it as such though) but I don't think the show has ever tried to insist that their feelings are actually the work of the curse. If anything I think it's going in a "you were always in love you just didn't realize it because both of you were guys" direction. Title: EP. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: I was all set to enjoy She Professed Herself the Pupil of the Wise Man and it's anime adaptation was total crap from the get-go(cramming an entire light novel into 2 episodes full of awful CGI) .  I only hoped I would enjoy this series, too.  It has gone well past my expectations and is all set to save my genderbender-loving heart this season.

I have read quite a bit of the light novel of that one, and the anime does the same thing to me.  If I had not read it, I would have no clue what is going on, but even then it changed a lot, skips so much.. I have no idea what they are trying to accomplish but I am not happy.

Title: EP. REVIEW: Life with an Ordinary Guy Who Reincarnated into a Total Fantasy Knockout [1/4] - Forum - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: I was considering dropping this (I've already dropped Wise man's loli and Leadale) but the last two episodes have been solid.   Once they introduced "Charmed" Jinguuji  didn't stand a chance, now all the Otome cliché's are truly out to get him....    "Boyfriend shirt" - top anime couple trigger...   Having re-watched the first episode the goddess didn't specifically mention what the curse was apart from the desire to "defeat the demon king". So they're probably suffering from their bromance being magnified now the potential homosexual hang-up has been removed.   Schwa-kun makes a good Kirito parody and if his real name is reveled and it is an SAO reference it'll be all the better.

News Crunchyroll Premieres 'Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove it' Anime Season 2 Ahead of Japanese Broadcast   posted on 2022-03-31 02:00 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Season 2 begins streaming on Friday at 7:00 a.m. EDT    Crunchyroll announced on Wednesday that it will stream the first episode of the second television  anime season based on Alifred Yamamoto's Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It (Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shōmei Shite Mita) manga early, several hours before the Japanese broadcast. The company will begin streaming Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It. r=1-sinθ on Friday at 7:00 a.m. EDT in North America, Central America, South America, Europe, Africa, Oceania, the Middle East, and the Commonwealth of Independent States.    The anime will premiere on the Tokyo MX channel on April 1 at 25:30 (effectively, April 2 at 1:30 a.m.), and will also air on BS NTV, Sun TV, Gunma TV, BS Fuji, AT-X, Hokkaido TV, Tochigi TV, and Television Nagasaki.    The new cast includes Marina Yamada as Suiu Fujiwara (name romanization not confirmed), Yuuki Kaji as Chris Floret (name romanization not confirmed), and Rena Hasegawa as Haru Kagurano.    Toru Kitahata (Haganai NEXT, Hinako Note) directed the first anime at Zero-G, with Kenta Onishi as assistant director, and Kouichirou Natsume as chief production supervisor. Rintarou Ikeda (Magical Sempai) supervised the scripts, and wrote them alongside Michiko Yokote (Shirobako, The Magnificent KOTOBUKI). Yūsuke Isouchi (One Piece) was the character designer and chief animation director. hisakuni, Shouichiro Hirata, Kaoru Ōtsuka, Shūhei Takahashi, Takuma Sogi, and Yūko Takahashi all composed the music.    Sora Amamiya performs the opening theme song "Love-Evidence" and CHICO with Honeyworks meets Mafumafu performs the ending theme song "Bibitto Love."    The first season premiered in Japan on Amazon Prime Video with all 12 episodes in January 2020. The show also aired on TV in Japan. Crunchyroll streamed the show as it aired and also streamed an English dub.    The manga launched on G-mode's Comic Meteor website in 2016. A live-action television series of the manga premiered in September 2018 and aired for four episodes. A live-action film opened in February 2019. News Crunchyroll Premieres 'Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove it' Anime Season 2 Ahead of Japanese Broadcast   posted on 2022-03-31 02:00 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Season 2 begins streaming on Friday at 7:00 a.m. EDT    Crunchyroll announced on Wednesday that it will stream the first episode of the second television  anime season based on Alifred Yamamoto's Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It (Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shōmei Shite Mita) manga early, several hours before the Japanese broadcast. The company will begin streaming Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It. r=1-sinθ on Friday at 7:00 a.m. EDT in North America, Central America, South America, Europe, Africa, Oceania, the Middle East, and the Commonwealth of Independent States.    The anime will premiere on the Tokyo MX channel on April 1 at 25:30 (effectively, April 2 at 1:30 a.m.), and will also air on BS NTV, Sun TV, Gunma TV, BS Fuji, AT-X, Hokkaido TV, Tochigi TV, and Television Nagasaki.    The new cast includes Marina Yamada as Suiu Fujiwara (name romanization not confirmed), Yuuki Kaji as Chris Floret (name romanization not confirmed), and Rena Hasegawa as Haru Kagurano.    Toru Kitahata (Haganai NEXT, Hinako Note) directed the first anime at Zero-G, with Kenta Onishi as assistant director, and Kouichirou Natsume as chief production supervisor. Rintarou Ikeda (Magical Sempai) supervised the scripts, and wrote them alongside Michiko Yokote (Shirobako, The Magnificent KOTOBUKI). Yūsuke Isouchi (One Piece) was the character designer and chief animation director. hisakuni, Shouichiro Hirata, Kaoru Ōtsuka, Shūhei Takahashi, Takuma Sogi, and Yūko Takahashi all composed the music.    Sora Amamiya performs the opening theme song "Love-Evidence" and CHICO with Honeyworks meets Mafumafu performs the ending theme song "Bibitto Love."    The first season premiered in Japan on Amazon Prime Video with all 12 episodes in January 2020. The show also aired on TV in Japan. Crunchyroll streamed the show as it aired and also streamed an English dub.    The manga launched on G-mode's Comic Meteor website in 2016. A live-action television series of the manga premiered in September 2018 and aired for four episodes. A live-action film opened in February 2019. Title: Crunchyroll Premieres 'Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove it' Anime Season 2 Ahead of Japanese Broadcast - News - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ×  remind me tomorrow remind me next week never remind me      Subscribe to the ANN Newsletter • Wake up every Sunday to a curated list of ANN's most interesting posts of the week.    read more           ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             News Crunchyroll Premieres 'Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove it' Anime Season 2 Ahead of Japanese Broadcast   posted on 2022-03-31 02:00 UTC-8 by Alex Mateo         Season 2 begins streaming on Friday at 7:00 a.m. EDT    Crunchyroll announced on Wednesday that it will stream the first episode of the second television  anime season based on Alifred Yamamoto's Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It (Rikei ga Koi ni Ochita no de Shōmei Shite Mita) manga early, several hours before the Japanese broadcast. The company will begin streaming Science Fell in Love, So I Tried to Prove It. r=1-sinθ on Friday at 7:00 a.m. EDT in North America, Central America, South America, Europe, Africa, Oceania, the Middle East, and the Commonwealth of Independent States.    The anime will premiere on the Tokyo MX channel on April 1 at 25:30 (effectively, April 2 at 1:30 a.m.), and will also air on BS NTV, Sun TV, Gunma TV, BS Fuji, AT-X, Hokkaido TV, Tochigi TV, and Television Nagasaki.    The new cast includes Marina Yamada as Suiu Fujiwara (name romanization not confirmed), Yuuki Kaji as Chris Floret (name romanization not confirmed), and Rena Hasegawa as Haru Kagurano.    Toru Kitahata (Haganai NEXT, Hinako Note) directed the first anime at Zero-G, with Kenta Onishi as assistant director, and Kouichirou Natsume as chief production supervisor. Rintarou Ikeda (Magical Sempai) supervised the scripts, and wrote them alongside Michiko Yokote (Shirobako, The Magnificent KOTOBUKI). Yūsuke Isouchi (One Piece) was the character designer and chief animation director. hisakuni, Shouichiro Hirata, Kaoru Ōtsuka, Shūhei Takahashi, Takuma Sogi, and Yūko Takahashi all composed the music.    Sora Amamiya performs the opening theme song "Love-Evidence" and CHICO with Honeyworks meets Mafumafu performs the ending theme song "Bibitto Love."    The first season premiered in Japan on Amazon Prime Video with all 12 episodes in January 2020. The show also aired on TV in Japan. Crunchyroll streamed the show as it aired and also streamed an English dub.    The manga launched on G-mode's Comic Meteor website in 2016. A live-action television series of the manga premiered in September 2018 and aired for four episodes. A live-action film opened in February 2019.    Source: Crunchyroll (Joseph Luster)        discuss this in the forum (2 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More

Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.               My Manga         My Manga is a place where you can organize all the manga you have read and want to read. You can 		create custom lists of titles and graphic novels 		 rate titles you've read 		 add your comments keep your lists private or make them public 		 look at other people's public lists for ideas of new manga to read (or avoid!) 		 and do all that for anime too. In order to use this feature you must be logged in. But you can get a feeling of what this feature offers by looking at other people's manga lists.              RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More

News Key's 2nd Kaginado Crossover Anime Season Announces More Cast, April 12 Premiere   posted on 2022-04-01 12:49 UTC-8 by Egan Loo         6 Angel Beats! cast members reprise roles    The official website for Kaginado  (Key, Etc.), the first crossover anime series featuring the franchises by Visual Arts' Key brand, confirmed more cast members and the April 12 premiere for the second season on Friday.     As teased in the previous visual above, six characters from the 2010 anime Angel Beats! will appear in the second season:     Hiroshi Kamiya as Yuzuru Otonashi  Harumi Sakurai as Yuri Nakamura  Kana Hanazawa as Tenshi  Ryohei Kimura as Hideki Hinata  Megumi Ogata as Ayato Naoi  Eri Kitamura as Yui   The season will premiere on the Tokyo MX channel on April 12 at 25:00 (effectively, April 13 at 1:00 a.m.), and it will also run on KBS Kyoto, Sun TV, Niigata TV 21, AT-X, BS NTV, Hokuriku Asahi Broadcasting, and Asahi Broadcasting Nagano. It will stream on various services in Japan at the same time as the Tokyo MX broadcast.    The first 12-episode Kaginado anime season premiered on Tokyo MX on October 12. The anime is streaming in various regions worldwide through Crunchyroll, Funimation, HIDIVE, Wakanim, Aniplus-Asia, bilibili, and Muse Asia.    Kazuya Sakamoto (Tabi-Hani) directed the first season at LIDEN FILMS Kyoto Studio. Takashi Aoshima (Rewrite episode script writer) was was the chief writer, and penned the scripts alongside Kai and Tōya Okano. Eriko Haga designed the characters. Kazunari Araki was credited for prop design. Yukihiro Shibutani was the art director, while Asami Kitsukawa was the color designer. Tomoaki Suzuki was the compositing director of photography. Kazuo Kajikawa was credited for editing. Akane Maeda was the sound director. Tohoku Shinsha Studio was credited for sound production. Visual Arts/Key was credited for the music.    The chibi-character anime is a crossover of some of Key's most popular visual novel and anime titles, including Kanon, Air, Clannad, Little Busters!, Rewrite, and planetarian.    Among the franchises in the crossover anime, noted Key writer Jun Maeda wrote the original visual novels for all but Rewrite, and also worked on the music for all of them (including Rewrite).    Kanon debuted in 1999, while Air debuted in 2000, and Clannad in 2004. Kanon had two television anime adaptations: the first by Toei Animation in 2002, and the second by Kyoto Animation in 2006. Kyoto Animation adapted Air into a television anime in 2005 as one of its first full productions as a studio, and Toei Animation also adapted it into an anime film in the same year. Kyoto Animation also animated the 2007 television anime of Clannad.    Little Busters! debuted in 2007, with J.C. Staff's anime adaptation premiering in 2012. Rewrite debuted in 2011, with the television anime by 8-Bit premiering in 2016. planetarian also inspired an anime in 2016. Kyoto Animation also animated the 2007 television anime of Clannad.    Little Busters! debuted in 2007, with J.C. Staff's anime adaptation premiering in 2012. Rewrite debuted in 2011, with the television anime by 8-Bit premiering in 2016. planetarian also inspired an anime in 2016. News Key's 2nd Kaginado Crossover Anime Season Announces More Cast, April 12 Premiere   posted on 2022-04-01 12:49 UTC-8 by Egan Loo         6 Angel Beats! cast members reprise roles    The official website for Kaginado  (Key, Etc.), the first crossover anime series featuring the franchises by Visual Arts' Key brand, confirmed more cast members and the April 12 premiere for the second season on Friday.     As teased in the previous visual above, six characters from the 2010 anime Angel Beats! will appear in the second season:     Hiroshi Kamiya as Yuzuru Otonashi  Harumi Sakurai as Yuri Nakamura  Kana Hanazawa as Tenshi  Ryohei Kimura as Hideki Hinata  Megumi Ogata as Ayato Naoi  Eri Kitamura as Yui   The season will premiere on the Tokyo MX channel on April 12 at 25:00 (effectively, April 13 at 1:00 a.m.), and it will also run on KBS Kyoto, Sun TV, Niigata TV 21, AT-X, BS NTV, Hokuriku Asahi Broadcasting, and Asahi Broadcasting Nagano. It will stream on various services in Japan at the same time as the Tokyo MX broadcast.    The first 12-episode Kaginado anime season premiered on Tokyo MX on October 12. The anime is streaming in various regions worldwide through Crunchyroll, Funimation, HIDIVE, Wakanim, Aniplus-Asia, bilibili, and Muse Asia.    Kazuya Sakamoto (Tabi-Hani) directed the first season at LIDEN FILMS Kyoto Studio. Takashi Aoshima (Rewrite episode script writer) was was the chief writer, and penned the scripts alongside Kai and Tōya Okano. Eriko Haga designed the characters. Kazunari Araki was credited for prop design. Yukihiro Shibutani was the art director, while Asami Kitsukawa was the color designer. Tomoaki Suzuki was the compositing director of photography. Kazuo Kajikawa was credited for editing. Akane Maeda was the sound director. Tohoku Shinsha Studio was credited for sound production. Visual Arts/Key was credited for the music.    The chibi-character anime is a crossover of some of Key's most popular visual novel and anime titles, including Kanon, Air, Clannad, Little Busters!, Rewrite, and planetarian.    Among the franchises in the crossover anime, noted Key writer Jun Maeda wrote the original visual novels for all but Rewrite, and also worked on the music for all of them (including Rewrite).    Kanon debuted in 1999, while Air debuted in 2000, and Clannad in 2004. Kanon had two television anime adaptations: the first by Toei Animation in 2002, and the second by Kyoto Animation in 2006. Kyoto Animation adapted Air into a television anime in 2005 as one of its first full productions as a studio, and Toei Animation also adapted it into an anime film in the same year. Kyoto Animation also animated the 2007 television anime of Clannad.    Little Busters! debuted in 2007, with J.C. Staff's anime adaptation premiering in 2012. Rewrite debuted in 2011, with the television anime by 8-Bit premiering in 2016. planetarian also inspired an anime in 2016. Title: Key's 2nd Kaginado Crossover Anime Season Announces More Cast, April 12 Premiere - News - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: ×  remind me tomorrow remind me next week never remind me      Subscribe to the ANN Newsletter • Wake up every Sunday to a curated list of ANN's most interesting posts of the week.    read more           ข่าวสารและบทความของ Anime News Network ในรูปแบบภาษาไทย สามารถติดตามอ่านได้แล้วที่ DEXclub         กรุณาเข้าไปเยี่ยมชมได้ที่ news.dexclub.com เพื่อติดตามอ่านข่าวสารล่าสุดในรูปแบบภาษาไทย          Anime News Network's news and articles are available in Thai from DEXclub.         Visit news.dexclub.com for all the latest news in Thai.             News Key's 2nd Kaginado Crossover Anime Season Announces More Cast, April 12 Premiere   posted on 2022-04-01 12:49 UTC-8 by Egan Loo         6 Angel Beats! cast members reprise roles    The official website for Kaginado  (Key, Etc.), the first crossover anime series featuring the franchises by Visual Arts' Key brand, confirmed more cast members and the April 12 premiere for the second season on Friday.     As teased in the previous visual above, six characters from the 2010 anime Angel Beats! will appear in the second season:     Hiroshi Kamiya as Yuzuru Otonashi  Harumi Sakurai as Yuri Nakamura  Kana Hanazawa as Tenshi  Ryohei Kimura as Hideki Hinata  Megumi Ogata as Ayato Naoi  Eri Kitamura as Yui   The season will premiere on the Tokyo MX channel on April 12 at 25:00 (effectively, April 13 at 1:00 a.m.), and it will also run on KBS Kyoto, Sun TV, Niigata TV 21, AT-X, BS NTV, Hokuriku Asahi Broadcasting, and Asahi Broadcasting Nagano. It will stream on various services in Japan at the same time as the Tokyo MX broadcast.    The first 12-episode Kaginado anime season premiered on Tokyo MX on October 12. The anime is streaming in various regions worldwide through Crunchyroll, Funimation, HIDIVE, Wakanim, Aniplus-Asia, bilibili, and Muse Asia.    Kazuya Sakamoto (Tabi-Hani) directed the first season at LIDEN FILMS Kyoto Studio. Takashi Aoshima (Rewrite episode script writer) was was the chief writer, and penned the scripts alongside Kai and Tōya Okano. Eriko Haga designed the characters. Kazunari Araki was credited for prop design. Yukihiro Shibutani was the art director, while Asami Kitsukawa was the color designer. Tomoaki Suzuki was the compositing director of photography. Kazuo Kajikawa was credited for editing. Akane Maeda was the sound director. Tohoku Shinsha Studio was credited for sound production. Visual Arts/Key was credited for the music.    The chibi-character anime is a crossover of some of Key's most popular visual novel and anime titles, including Kanon, Air, Clannad, Little Busters!, Rewrite, and planetarian.    Among the franchises in the crossover anime, noted Key writer Jun Maeda wrote the original visual novels for all but Rewrite, and also worked on the music for all of them (including Rewrite).    Kanon debuted in 1999, while Air debuted in 2000, and Clannad in 2004. Kanon had two television anime adaptations: the first by Toei Animation in 2002, and the second by Kyoto Animation in 2006. Kyoto Animation adapted Air into a television anime in 2005 as one of its first full productions as a studio, and Toei Animation also adapted it into an anime film in the same year. Kyoto Animation also animated the 2007 television anime of Clannad.    Little Busters! debuted in 2007, with J.C. Staff's anime adaptation premiering in 2012. Rewrite debuted in 2011, with the television anime by 8-Bit premiering in 2016. planetarian also inspired an anime in 2016.    Source: Kaginado anime's website, Comic Natalie        discuss this in the forum (5 posts) |        bookmark/share with:                News homepage / archives           RightStuf - Anime, Manga and More

Title: Key's 2nd Kaginado Crossover Anime Season Announces More Cast, April 12 Premiere - News - Anime News Network:SEA
Data: 6 Angel Beats! cast members reprise roles    The official website for Kaginado  (Key, Etc.), the first crossover anime series featuring the franchises by Visual Arts' Key brand, confirmed more cast members and the April 12 premiere for the second season on Friday.     As teased in the previous visual above, six characters from the 2010 anime Angel Beats! will appear in the second season:     Hiroshi Kamiya as Yuzuru Otonashi  Harumi Sakurai as Yuri Nakamura  Kana Hanazawa as Tenshi  Ryohei Kimura as Hideki Hinata  Megumi Ogata as Ayato Naoi  Eri Kitamura as Yui   The season will premiere on the Tokyo MX channel on April 12 at 25:00 (effectively, April 13 at 1:00 a.m.), and it will also run on KBS Kyoto, Sun TV, Niigata TV 21, AT-X, BS NTV, Hokuriku Asahi Broadcasting, and Asahi Broadcasting Nagano. It will stream on various services in Japan at the same time as the Tokyo MX broadcast.    The first 12-episode Kaginado anime season premiered on Tokyo MX on October 12. The anime is streaming in various regions worldwide through Crunchyroll, Funimation, HIDIVE, Wakanim, Aniplus-Asia, bilibili, and Muse Asia.    Kazuya Sakamoto (Tabi-Hani) directed the first season at LIDEN FILMS Kyoto Studio. Takashi Aoshima (Rewrite episode script writer) was was the chief writer, and penned the scripts alongside Kai and Tōya Okano. Eriko Haga designed the characters. Kazunari Araki was credited for prop design. Yukihiro Shibutani was the art director, while Asami Kitsukawa was the color designer. Tomoaki Suzuki was the compositing director of photography. Kazuo Kajikawa was credited for editing. Akane Maeda was the sound director. Tohoku Shinsha Studio was credited for sound production. Visual Arts/Key was credited for the music.    The chibi-character anime is a crossover of some of Key's most popular visual novel and anime titles, including Kanon, Air, Clannad, Little Busters!, Rewrite, and planetarian.    Among the franchises in the crossover anime, noted Key writer Jun Maeda wrote the original visual novels for all but Rewrite, and also worked on the music for all of them (including Rewrite).    Kanon debuted in 1999, while Air debuted in 2000, and Clannad in 2004. Kanon had two television anime adaptations: the first by Toei Animation in 2002, and the second by Kyoto Animation in 2006. Kyoto Animation adapted Air into a television anime in 2005 as one of its first full productions as a studio, and Toei Animation also adapted it into an anime film in the same year. Kyoto Animation also animated the 2007 television anime of Clannad.    Little Busters! debuted in 2007, with J.C. Staff's anime adaptation premiering in 2012. Rewrite debuted in 2011, with the television anime by 8-Bit premiering in 2016. planetarian also inspired an anime in 2016.    Source: Kaginado anime's website, Comic Natalie

If you have seen it before, is this edition worth your time? Lastly, what are the special features that make this the "perfect edition?" For the uninitiated, ...

But with so much unresolved, how will it wrap things up? Michael Lacerna 1 day ago                      Wikipedia's April Fools' Gag Involves Isekai Anime’s Most Common Trope  Wikipedia calls out an overused isekai anime trope and the genre's most important character, Truck-kun, for its yearly April Fools' gag.  Michael Lacerna 1 day ago                      Choujin X's Latest Enemy Choujin Proves That Paper Cuts Can Be Deadly  In Chapter 18 of Choujin X, Tokio meets Ririka Umezawa in a head-to-head battle that ends with some unlucky consequences. Title: Hatsune Miku's Strangest Anime Appearance Was in Shinkalion
Data: www.cbr.com                  CBR Exclusives   Comics   Comics News   Comic Features   Comic Previews   Comic Reviews     Movies    Movie News   Movie Features   Movie Reviews     TV    TV News   TV Features   TV Reviews   Wrestling     Anime   Gaming   Lists   Write For CBR   More   CBR Forums   Buyer's Guides   Nerd Culture   Find a Comic Shop       Follow Us   Follow CBR.com         Something New                    	Covering the hottest movie and TV topics that fans want.                                      	All the latest gaming news, game reviews and trailers                                      	A one-stop shop for all things video games.                       More  Write For Us Home Contact Us Terms Privacy Copyright About Us Press Kit Find a Comic Shop Fact Checking Policy Corrections Policy Ethics Policy Ownership Policy                                             Home Anime Dropkick On My Devil X Isn't Hatsune Miku's First (Or Weirdest) Anime Appearance        Dropkick On My Devil X Isn't Hatsune Miku's First (Or Weirdest) Anime Appearance Vocaloid sensation Hatsune Miku has been in many anime series, but none of her appearances are as odd as Shinkalion.      By Jonathon Greenall Published 3 hours ago      Share    Share    Tweet    Email    0 Comment                    Hatsune Miku is an icon. First launched in 2007, the anthropomorphic representation of the popular Vocaloid voicebank has become a massive and recognized star worldwide. The character has since appeared in countless video games, anime series and other media. It was also recently confirmed that Miku will appear in a special crossover series called Dropkick on My Devil! X Mame Anime, which will promote the island of Hokkaido. However, this isn't Hatsune Miku's first anime appearance -- nor is it the weirdest. In 2018, Hatsune Miku appeared in an anime called Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion. This train-based mecha series, created by Takara Tomy and Japan Railways Group, follows a young boy who loves trains named Hayato Hayasugi. One day, Hayato learns his father is secretly working for the Shinkansen Ultra Evolution Institute, a secretive organization that creates Shinkalions to fight monsters that try to attack Japan. The boy turns out to have an aptitude for piloting Shinkalions and becomes the pilot of the Shinkalion E5 Hayabusa.  Related: Gundam's Iron-Blooded Orphans Spinoff Trailer Introduces a Slew of New Characters and Mecha                  Miku appears in the anime's 15th episode, "Go North!! Shinkalion H5 Hayabusa." Hayato and his friends realize their mysterious foe is planning to spread panic by revealing monsters to the world, and they're soon proved right when one attacks Hakodate in Hokkaido. The pilots dive into their Shinkalions and head there to fight, but realize they're not going to make it in time. However, before the plan can come to fruition, another Shinkalion enters the fray. Hayato and his friends are initially confused when they learn the pilot is a girl with distinctive blue twin tails and a robotic voice. This girl holds the monster off, eventually destroying it with her robot's finishing move. After the battle, she introduces herself as Hatsune Miku. However, this Miku differs a little from her usual forms found in other media. Here, she is an eleven-year-old girl who wants to become a Shinkalion driver but is held back by motion sickness. When Hayato falls ill, Miku once again must dive into battle in her Shinkalion, proving herself as a pilot. Shinkalion's Miku lore is full of references to the original Vocaloid. The character is voiced by Saki Fujita, the actress whose voice is the basis for the singer's voicebank. Her age of 11 references the fact that the Miku voicebank was 11 years old at the time of the episode's release. Her being based at the Shinkansen Ultra Evolution Institute's Hokkaido Branch references the headquarters of Crypton Future Media -- the company behind the Miku voicebank. Related: Rising of the Shield Hero and Bofuri Collide in Isekai Crossover Promotion                  However, this isn't Miku's only appearance in the franchise. She would show up several times during the series and also appears in the movie Shinkansen Henkei Robo Shinkalion the Movie: The Marvelous Fast ALFA-X That Comes From the Future. This film reveals that in the time since the end of the original series, Miku has become a singer just like her Vocaloid counterpart. Her appearance here also means she has fought against a form of Godzilla and fought alongside Shinji from Neon Genesis Evangelion, further proving that Shinkalion is home to some of anime's most unexpected crossovers. Dropkick On My Devil will not be the last time Miku is seen in an anime. She's become such a part of anime fan culture that she'll inevitably make another crossover or cameo appearance. However, it will be hard to top her Shinkalion role for pure weirdness, especially as the anime made Miku a unique character in its own universe while paying tribute to the original Vocaloid. This cameo also tops the oddity charts because it means that Miku has technically crossed over with loads of other franchises due to Shinkalion's own number of cameos and crossovers. Title: Strongest Sage’s Finale Falls Flat
Data: www.cbr.com                  CBR Exclusives   Comics   Comics News   Comic Features   Comic Previews   Comic Reviews     Movies    Movie News   Movie Features   Movie Reviews     TV    TV News   TV Features   TV Reviews   Wrestling     Anime   Gaming   Lists   Write For CBR   More   CBR Forums   Buyer's Guides   Nerd Culture   Find a Comic Shop       Follow Us   Follow CBR.com         Something New                    	Covering the hottest movie and TV topics that fans want.                                      	All the latest gaming news, game reviews and trailers                                      	A one-stop shop for all things video games.                       More  Write For Us Home Contact Us Terms Privacy Copyright About Us Press Kit Find a Comic Shop Fact Checking Policy Corrections Policy Ethics Policy Ownership Policy                                             Home Anime The Strongest Sage’s Final Episode Leaves a Lot to Be Desired        The Strongest Sage’s Final Episode Leaves a Lot to Be Desired Matty Hildesheimer's life is on the line as he battles the powerful ancient demon Zardias in The Strongest Sage season finale, but is victory earned?     By Diane Darcy Published 23 hours ago      Share    Share    Tweet    Email    0 Comment                    WARNING: The following contains spoilers for Episode 12 of The Strongest Sage With The Weakest Crest, "The Strongest Sage Goes on a Journey Again," now streaming on Crunchyroll. In Episode 1 of The Strongest Sage With The Weakest, Gaius induced his reincarnation to obtain the four crests he desired. In the era of his original incarnation, the four crests were considered the most powerful in battle. 5,000 years later, Gaius is reborn with the four crests as a boy named Matthias “Matty” Hildesheimer, although in this timeline, the four crests is rejected as the weakest. As such, he was only able to enroll in the second-tier magic school known as the Second Academy in the kingdom of Eis.  Throughout the series, Matty reveals that he retained the memories of his past incarnation and uses his past life experiences in battles against demons. He also reveals through exposition the magical tools he invented in his past life that allow him to win fights against demons with little to no effort. During his stay at the Second Academy, Matty befriended his classmates Lurie and Alma, although he hasn't said anything about who he really is to them. Along the way, he was also reacquainted with his old friend Iris the darkness dragon -- the only one who knows his secret. RELATED: The Strongest Sage Meets His Equal as a Demon Slayer                  After stopping various demonic invasions throughout the series, Matty encountered a demonic presence he couldn't beat: the ancient demon Zardias who knew him as Gaius. Since that discovery, Matty set about locating the demon, which required the use of an ancient device he invented. Unfortunately for Matty, Zardias broke out of his magic prison the moment he determined his location and set course for the kingdom of Eis. With his resident kingdom in danger, Matty tasks Lurie and Alma with retrieving an ancient sword he invented in his former life while he battles Zardias alongside Iris. The fight against Zardias proves to be nothing like Matty's earlier battles. Zardias is a lot stronger and deadlier than the demons Matty previously defeated, and his strategies don't work on the ancient demon. On top of that, Zardias shows he has tricks of his own, one of which ends up wounding Matty. This forces Matty to realize he'll have to sacrifice his current incarnation to defeat the demon, or humanity is done for. Since letting humanity die is not an option for Matty, he contemplates using his remaining magic to kill the demon and perform another reincarnation spell to save himself. While reincarnation is Matty's only viable option in a deadly situation, there's one problem: if he reincarnates into another future timeline, Lurie and Alma will no longer be part of his life, as they will be long dead. Realizing he has grown fond of both girls and wants to remain with them along with Iris, Matty decides to hold off the demon a bit longer until Lurie arrives with the sword he needs. While Lurie does succeed at her task, Zardias delivers a fatal attack on Matty when he's not looking, successfully killing him. RELATED: The Strongest Sage: A Demonic Encounter Nearly Kills a Powerful Demon Slayer                  Seeing Matty brutally killed before her eyes proves too much for Lurie to handle. This feeling is only made worse by the fact she had given Matty the sword just seconds before Zardias impaled him with his own weapon. Before Lurie has the chance to grieve Matty's death, however, the sword in his possession activates and restores him to life. The sword also restores his magic, making him stronger and more powerful than before. This gives Matty the power boost he needs to destroy Zardias, which he does quickly without any consequence to himself. In the aftermath of the battle, everything in the kingdom of Eis returns to normal as if the threat of Zardias never happened. Even after his brief run-in with death, Matty doesn't seem fazed by the events that transpired. Lurie, however, is very shaken by the experience and admits her feelings for Matty by hugging him. While Matty doesn't use this opportunity to reciprocate her feelings, he does decide to do something nice for her to subtly let her know how much she means to him. While out shopping with the reward money he earned for defeating Zardias, Matty buys a blue stone that he reshapes into a pendant for a necklace. When he asks Lurie to meet him in private one night, Lurie thinks the intimate nature of their meeting is going to lead to them kissing. However, Matty only gives her the necklace he made for her. Although Lurie is grateful for Matty's gift, she doesn't take it as romantic confirmation of his feelings. Matty also doesn't use this opportunity to tell her the truth of who he really is or his past as Gaius as a way of progressing their relationship. This indicates that while Matty does love Lurie, he also doesn't trust her enough to tell her his secret. As such, The Strongest Sage With The Weakest Crest ends its first season on a rather anticlimactic note. KEEP READING: The Strongest Sage Fights His Deadliest Enemy With Devastating Consequences      Share    Share    Tweet    Email    0 Comment                   My Dress-Up Darling Recreates Miss Nagatoro! Again - For All the Right Reasons    Related Topics  Anime The Strongest Sage with the Weakest Crest     About The Author                    Diane Darcy                                         (280 Articles Published)   Diane Darcy is a features writer for CBR with an educational background in psychology. She is also a graphic designer and a podcaster. As a huge lover of anime, manga, comics, film and television, Diane created several fan blogs and websites over the years. Her most popular blog is the Helena Wayne Huntress blog. Diane has also contributed publications to WWAC, Comics Bookcase, and Shelfdust. Diane is also a regular podcaster on DC Comics and Doctor Who for the Wright On Network. While Lurie does succeed at her task, Zardias delivers a fatal attack on Matty when he's not looking, successfully killing him. RELATED: The Strongest Sage: A Demonic Encounter Nearly Kills a Powerful Demon Slayer                  Seeing Matty brutally killed before her eyes proves too much for Lurie to handle. This feeling is only made worse by the fact she had given Matty the sword just seconds before Zardias impaled him with his own weapon. Before Lurie has the chance to grieve Matty's death, however, the sword in his possession activates and restores him to life. The sword also restores his magic, making him stronger and more powerful than before. This gives Matty the power boost he needs to destroy Zardias, which he does quickly without any consequence to himself. In the aftermath of the battle, everything in the kingdom of Eis returns to normal as if the threat of Zardias never happened. Even after his brief run-in with death, Matty doesn't seem fazed by the events that transpired. Lurie, however, is very shaken by the experience and admits her feelings for Matty by hugging him. While Matty doesn't use this opportunity to reciprocate her feelings, he does decide to do something nice for her to subtly let her know how much she means to him. While out shopping with the reward money he earned for defeating Zardias, Matty buys a blue stone that he reshapes into a pendant for a necklace. When he asks Lurie to meet him in private one night, Lurie thinks the intimate nature of their meeting is going to lead to them kissing. However, Matty only gives her the necklace he made for her. Although Lurie is grateful for Matty's gift, she doesn't take it as romantic confirmation of his feelings. Matty also doesn't use this opportunity to tell her the truth of who he really is or his past as Gaius as a way of progressing their relationship. This indicates that while Matty does love Lurie, he also doesn't trust her enough to tell her his secret. As such, The Strongest Sage With The Weakest Crest ends its first season on a rather anticlimactic note.
